meanings.definition: To break into and steal from a building or home.
meanings.sent1: The thief tried to burglarize the house by entering through the window.
meanings.sent2: Criminals often burglarize homes when the owners are away on vacation.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cat try to burglarize the fishbowl? Silly kitty!
meanings.sent4: The idea of someone trying to burglarize my thoughts is unsettling.
meanings.sent5: The image of a masked figure attempting to burglarize a library is quite vivid.

meanings.sent1: The suspect was caught red-handed trying to burglarize the jewelry store.
meanings.sent2: In movies, the villains often burglarize banks for dramatic heist scenes.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I would see a penguin trying to burglarize an igloo!
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to burglarize the room, taking in every detail.
meanings.sent5: The thought of someone trying to burglarize my dreams is both eerie and fascinating.
